description: From Middle English ungod, from Old English ungōd, equivalent to un- (“not”) +‎ good (adjective). Popularised by its appearance in Newspeak, a fictional language coined in Nineteen Eighty-Four (1949), a dystopian novel by George Orwell.

adjectives.description: ungood (comparative more ungood, superlative most ungood)

entries.meaning: (in the plural) Those who are not good; the wicked, evil, or bad

description: From Middle English ungod (“evil”), equivalent to un- (“lack of”) +‎ good (noun). Cognate with German Low German Ungood (“bad, evil”), German Ungüte (“ungood”).

entries.meaning: (rare) Lack or absence of good; goodlessness; bad
